article:
A 'Endoribonuclease' is a ribonuclease endonuclease. It cleaves either single-
stranded or double-stranded RNA, depending on the enzyme. Example includes both
single proteins like RNase III, RNase A, RNase T1, and RNase H, and also
complexes of proteins with RNA like RNase P and the RNA-induced silencing
complex. Further examples include, Endoribonuclease XendoU found in frogs
(Xenopus).
